dbms.bplus
Class SecondaryBPlusTree

java.lang.Object
  dbms.bplus.SecondaryBPlusTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class SecondaryBPlusTree
extends Object
implements Serializable

Implemenents a B+ Tree that is being used as a secondary index in our DBMS System.

See Also:

See Also:
Constant Field Values

root

private Node root
The root node.

firstLeaf

private SecondaryLeaf firstLeaf
The first leaf (SecondaryLeaf) of our B+ Tree.

bucketFactor

private final int bucketFactor
The bucket factor.

bucketFactorDiv2

private final int bucketFactorDiv2
The ceiling of the bucketFactor divided by 2. It is used to define the minimum number of children a node can have in the B+ Tree.

keyIndex

private final int keyIndex
The key index.

name

private final String name
The name.

Constructor Detail

SecondaryBPlusTree

public SecondaryBPlusTree(int keyIndex,
                          PrimaryBPlusTree primaryTree,
                          String name)
Creates the secondary B+ tree by assigning values to the bucketFactor field taken from the primary B+ Tree, the keyIndex and the name fields with values taken from the parameters.

Parameters:
keyIndex - The key index.
primaryTree - The primary tree (index).
name - The name.

private LinkedList<SecondaryLeaf> fillLeaves(LinkedList<Reference> references)
Fills the leaves using the references that have been previously created.

references - The references to the primary tree.
Returns:
A LinkedList of the SecondaryLeaf created.

fillInnerNode

private void fillInnerNode(InnerNode node,
                           LinkedList<SecondaryLeaf> allLeaves)
Fills a node with the leaves previously created until the node is replete.

Parameters:
node - The inner node.
allLeaves - The list with all the leaves created.

                             Node secondChild,

firstChild - The first child.
secondChild - The second child.

reconstructInnerNodes

private void reconstructInnerNodes(int key,
                                   InnerNode currentNode,
                                   Node newChild)
Reconstructs inner nodes after new nodes have been created (perhaps from a split procedure). Also checks if replition takes place.

Parameters:
key - The current node's key.
currentNode - The current node.
newChild - The new node.

splitInnerNode

private InnerNode splitInnerNode(InnerNode currentNode)
Splits an inner node to two and places bucketFactorDiv2 children to the first and the rest to the second. The parent(s) and the appropriate fields are updated too.

Parameters:
currentNode - The node to be splited.
Returns:
The new InnerNode.

search

private SecondaryLeaf search(int key)
Searches for a secondary leaf using its key. When the secondary leaf is found it is returned.

Parameters:
key - The key of the primary leaf-target.
Returns:
The desired SecondaryLeaf.

insert

public void insert(Reference reference)
Inserts a new record to the appropriate position inside the Secondary B+ Tree.

Parameters:
reference - The reference to the leaf that the insertion must take place.

splitLeaf

private SecondaryLeaf splitLeaf(SecondaryLeaf currentLeaf)
Splits a secondary leaf to two and adjusts the connections of the children-nodes with their neighbours.

Parameters:
currentLeaf - The current secondary leaf.
Returns:
The new leaf.

reconstructTree

private void reconstructTree(SecondaryLeaf currentLeaf,
                             SecondaryLeaf newLeaf)
Reconstructs the tree in order to adjust it to changes that may have happened (e.g. after secondary leaf's split).

Parameters:
currentLeaf - The current leaf.
newLeaf - The new leaf.

delete

public Object[] delete(int secondaryKey)
Deletes a record (the one with key equal to the one given in the parameter) and creates references to the elements of the primary tree that must be deleted.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search.
  • A LinkedList object with the references of the records that must be deleted.

deleteAllGreaterOrEqual

public Object[] deleteAllGreaterOrEqual(int secondaryKey)
Same as the delete method except here we delete all the records with key greater or equal to the one given to the parameter.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - The desired key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search
  • A LinkedList object with the references of the records that must be deleted.

deleteAllLessOrEqual

public Object[] deleteAllLessOrEqual(int secondaryKey)
Same as the delete method except that it deletes all the records with keys less or equal to secondaryKey/.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - Tthe desired key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search.
  • A LinkedList object with the references of the records that must be deleted.

delete

public void delete(LinkedList<Object[]> deleted)
It is used to delete records after a deletion made in a primary index. There is a possibility that we may have a value that spans over multiple leaves. This method checks these leaves too and if such values exist it deletes them also.

Parameters:
deleted - The list with the references that were deleted from the primary index.

find

public Object[] find(int secondaryKey)
Finds a record (the one with secondary key equal to the one given in the parameter) and returns it.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - The desired key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search process.
  • A LinkedList object with the references that must be retrieved.

findAllGreaterOrEqual

public Object[] findAllGreaterOrEqual(int secondaryKey)
Same as the find method except here we search for all the records with secondary key greater or equal to secondaryKey.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - The desired key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search process.
  • A LinkedList object with the references that must be retrieved.

findAllLessOrEqual

public Object[] findAllLessOrEqual(int secondaryKey)
Same as the find method except here we search for all the records with secondary key lesser or equal to secondaryKey

Parameters:
secondaryKey - The desired key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search process.
  • A LinkedList object with the references that must be retrieved.

findAllInRange

public Object[] findAllInRange(int firstSecondaryKey,
                               int lastSecondaryKey)
Same as the find method except that it finds all the records in the open range between firstSecondaryKey and lastSecondaryKey.

Parameters:
firstSecondaryKey - The first key.
lastSecondaryKey - The last key the index of the key.
Returns:
A Result [2] array which contains:
  • A boolean variable to verify the success of the search process.
  • A LinkedList object with the references that must be retrieved.

updateReferences

public void updateReferences(LinkedList<Record> recordsMoved,
                             LinkedList<Reference> oldReferenceList,
                             LinkedList<Reference> newReferenceList)
It updates the references using the reference lists according to which the records were moved.

Parameters:
recordsMoved - The records that were moved.
oldReferenceList - The list with old references.
newReferenceList - The list with the new references.
